moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3: Threatens the pawn with the knight.
moves.2... Nc6 3. Bc4: This is a very attacking move.
moves.3... Nf6: Not a very good move, leads to the Fried Liver Gambit.
moves.4... d5: The only way to block the threat.
moves.5. exd5 Nxd5: Some people think the exchange can be dangerous.
moves.6... Kxf7 7. Qf3+: Checking the king and threatening the knight on d5.
moves.7... Ke6: The only way to protect the knight.
moves.8... Nce7 9. d4: If the pawn is taken, white wins the knight after: exd4 10. Qe4. The king moves out of check and white takes the knight with the knight or the bishop.
moves.10. dxe5 g6 11. Bg5: Threatening to eliminate one of the knights protecters.
moves.11... h6: A weak attempt to stop the bishop on g5.
moves.12. Bxe7: Takes the knight, and black's knight is now slightly more unprotected.
moves.12... Bxe7 13. O-O-O: The knight is now under heaps of pressure.
moves.13... Bg5+ 14. Kb1 Qd7: Preparing for Rd8, giving extra protection.
moves.15. Rhe1: Ignoring the exchange which will come to white's advantage, white instead prepares for an attack.
moves.15... Rd8 16. Qg4+: The king must give up the protection of the knight.
moves.18... Qa4: Threatens the bishop, who is pinned to the queen.
moves.20... Bf6 21. Qxg6 dxc4: The bishop does not matter in this position, as white is on the offense.
moves.22... Kxd8 23. Qxf6+: The game is equal and black is in trouble.
moves.23... Kc7 24. Qf7+ Kb6: Retreating to the other side of the board.
moves.25... cxb3: Threatens mate in two, but black misses Qb3, checking the king and giving white another move, which he will use to get two queens.
moves.26. Qxb3+ Kc7 27. e8=Q: The swap is offered. If black do not accept, they are stuffed within a few moves.
moves.27... Qxe8 28. Rxe8 Kd6: Trying to get to the centre of the board, where it is harder to checkmate.
moves.29. Qd3+ Kc7 30. Rd8 b5: Now the king is safe from side-attacks at a5.
moves.31. Qd6+ Kb7: This is almost the position of one of my puzzles.
moves.33. Rd6+: The king is forced to play a5.
moves.34... Ka4 35. a3: The pawn moves up, and now the king is in checkmate in one move no matter what.

gameName: Fried Liver Gambit - SO vs. SOE IV
opening: two knights defence (C57), Fegatello attack, Polerio defence
